ratings.comment: Honestly one of the best teachers I've ever had.  He was so helpful and very passionate about everything he taught.  A lot of the reading seemed dumb at first, but eventually I saw the purpose and I liked it a lot more.  I would die happy if he taught all of my classes.  Loved him.

I looked forward to this class going in, but it turned out to be a disappointment. The lectures involved the professor talking/rambling for the entire 50 min. Some lectures were interesting but many were very repetitive. The grading for this class was horrific, subjective and they often gave poor grades without being able to explain why if asked.

Decent professor, awful class. He wasn't very clear on his lectures and taught right off the powerpoint. He also made these childish puns every lecture. The TA's are what made this class absolutely awful, especially mine who just enjoyed to hear herself talk and didn't care about the students. I don't recommend this class to anyone.

Dumb class. It is completely opinionated and you don't learn anything useful, just what he thinks. He argues completely random things and makes obvious observations. The projects are vague and preparing for tests consists of memorizing his opinions. Best part of the class was when the engineer prof. came in and dissed him.
Boss. Take this class. One of the best Professors I have had.

Andrew was super friendly. I was in a FIG and he came on field trips with us. He's super nice and totally relateable (and totally hot when he's not in class). I would for sure take a class from him again.

This was my favorite class this semester. He's very helpful and extremely interested in what he's teaching. His lectures are engaging and funny at the same time (He uses a lot of puns!). Overall great class and I'd recommend him as a professor for any class he teaches.

Andrew has really been my favorite professor this semester. Very straightforward and really interested and immersed in what he's teaching, which makes it easier to listen. He's a really approachable guy and the reading for the class is generally really interesting.

Andrew is a great teacher.  His lectures were very organized and easy to understand.  Andrew is very interesting to listen to, even if the topic wasn't; he made the topic bearable and easily understandable.  His grading and tests were easy, but he handed out a lot of reading and essays.  Instructions and clarity for his projects were incomplete.

Super interesting and made really good points.  Would recommend him/this class to anyone at UW.  Readings are interesting, well-selected, and important to read (all are online, no textbook.)  Only complaint is that some questions on his tests are misleading and have more than one correct answer.  Definitely try to go in and argue.

Awesome professor!  Would highly recommend this class.  He only teaches for 1st half though.  Lectures really interesting, slides very clear.  Exams are based off slides & lectures--not hard, but not easy.  He keeps you interested in the lecture from start to finish.
